page.title: 20Southmoor Bakery
page.content: The bakery makes bread for southmoor and surroundihg villages. Mr Garrett the baker gets up at 3a.m. He makes dough from flour and yeast and puts it in to shapes and tins. He puts them into a prover where they expand before finally placing them in a big oven to bake. He bakes 300 loaves a day. The bread and buns are sold in the post office next door.It also sells stamps,cards,shoes,toys and swimming costumes.Usually they have two people serving.The local people use it for their local bakery and shop.Some bread is delivered by van to other shops and villages. The flour comes from Clarks mill in Wantage.There,wheat is unloaded.It is sieved.Canadian and English wheat are mixed together.They are ground 7 times for white flour.The husk is added for wholemeal flour. It is then bagged.
